data.name: Braces with content
data.description:
Implement a class called "Brace" with a static method called "CreateRoot" that takes a string parameter which ideally would be a "code document" (C, Java, Js etc..). The method will create an instance of Brace which will contain the document. Like in the Kata "Valid Braces" (thanks for the idea) a "Brace" will be valid if all of its sub-nodes including itself will be valid.
Eg.
```private string Test(string name)```
```{```
``` return "Hello " + name;```
```}```
will be valid and brace will contain:
root content: private string Test
a level 1 node: (string name)
a level 1 node: { return "Hello " + name; }
All sub-nodes of a Brace will be inside "InnerBraces" and the upper-node (parent) will be OuterBrace.
Braces wouldn't be considered if inside comments or strings so for example:
Any Parenthesis found it won't be considered if within comments or strings.
Eg.
```private string Test(string name)```
```{```
``` return "[:) Hello " + name;```
```}```
will result in a valid Brace
See example test cases for better understanding.
